title: 107_hr542
content: The Act may be cited as the "Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999". The Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999 acknowledges the importance of small businesses in job creation and aims to reduce regulatory burdens on them. It highlights the effectiveness of the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process in allowing small businesses to participate in the development of regulations by federal agencies. The Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999 aims to enhance small businesses' participation in the federal regulatory process. It clarifies and strengthens the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process and expands the number of federal agencies required to convene these panels. SEC. 3. Ensuring full analysis of potential impacts on small entities of rules proposed by certain agencies. Section 609(b) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to require covered agencies to notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This includes providing information on the potential impacts of the proposed rule on small entities and identifying affected small entity representatives within 30 days. The covered agency must notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This involves identifying affected small entity representatives and obtaining advice on potential impacts of the draft proposed rule. After transmitting this information, a review panel consisting of federal employees and relevant offices must be convened not earlier than 30 days later. The review panel, consisting of federal employees from the covered agency, the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, and the Chief Counsel, will review materials prepared for the proposed rule, gather advice from small entity representatives, and allow them to make oral presentations. The panel must be convened within 60 days after the covered agency notifies the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration. The review panel, comprised of federal employees, will gather advice from small entity representatives and allow oral presentations. Within 60 days, the panel must report to the agency head on received comments and findings on specific issues. The agency head must publish the panel's report in the Federal Register within 120 days of receiving it. The review panel's report must be registered in the Federal Register within 120 days of receipt by the agency head, or as part of the notice of proposed rulemaking. The covered agency may need to modify the proposed rule or regulatory analysis as necessary. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Amends Section 609(d) of title 5, United States Code to define 'covered agency' as EPA, OSHA, and IRS, and 'small entity representative' as a small entity or its representative. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act takes effect 90 days after enactment.
